intro: Fimbristylis capillacea, commonly known as the silky flatsedge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along waterways. Its slender, grass-like leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Fimbristylis capillacea produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
